qas.question: Who was the first non-Fujiwara emperor since the ninth century?
Who implemented reforms to reduce the Fujiwara's influence on government?
What term was used for behind the scenes governance?
Who was the last emperor born to a Fujiwara mother?
What did the Fjiware try to compile and validate?
Who felt threatened by the Fujiware attempt to validate estate records?
What office did the emperor rule through?

context: The <b4_0>Fujiwara<b4_0/> controlled the throne until the reign of Emperor <a0_0><a1_0><b3_0>Go-Sanjō<b3_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/> (1068-1073), the first emperor not born of a Fujiwara mother since the ninth century. Go-Sanjo, determined to restore imperial control through strong personal rule, implemented reforms to curb Fujiwara influence. He also established an office to compile and validate <b5_0>estate records<b5_0/> with the aim of reasserting central control. Many <b6_0>shōen<b6_0/> were not properly certified, and large landholders, like the Fujiwara, felt threatened with the loss of their lands. Go-Sanjo also established the In-no-cho (ja:院庁 <b7_0>Office of the Cloistered Emperor<b7_0/>), which was held by a succession of emperors who abdicated to devote themselves to behind-the-scenes governance, or <a2_0>insei<a2_0/>.
